bug.author: dietercastel
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Bug Description</denchmark-h>
The load_raw_image example in the load_raw_image.zip under examples still contains the old naming convention: from autokeras.classifier import load_image_dataset While the current (and working) example in the github pages reads: from autokeras.image_supervised import load_image_dataset <denchmark-h:h3>Reproducing Steps</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Step 1: Download zip and extract Step 2: See for yourself
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
A working example on download :-) Might I suggest removing the code from the zip file and just placing it on git. So it can more easily be spotted and updated. Since I assume the image files will remain the same leaving them in a zip makes sense I guess.

comments.comment: I might fix this myself tomorrow if you agree with my proposed solution or provide a better suggestion.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/dietercastel>@dietercastel</denchmark-link> Thank you so much! You can go ahead a fix it.
